The claim was fact: checked by examining the authenticity of the alleged CNN tweet that stated "Due to COVID-19, President Donald Trump passes away at 74." The expert searched for evidence of this tweet on Twitter and found an identical tweet on Oct. 9 that used the Fox News logo but was not from the official Fox News account.
The expert also considered the timing of: s activities. It was noted that President Trump had been campaigning and participating in public events, including a televised town hall, since leaving the hospital on Oct. 5 for COVID-19 treatment. This contradicted the claim of his passing.
The post spreading the claim was flagged: s efforts to combat false news and misinformation on its News Feed. This indicates that the claim was deemed suspicious and required further verification.
The expert: s verdict emphasized the lack of evidence to support the claim. They stated that they did not find any evidence that CNN had ever tweeted about President Trump's death. This lack of evidence further undermined the authenticity of the claim.
